Gomes uspešno operisan, očekuje se potpuni oporavak
Dobre vesti stižu sa Gudisona

04 Nov 2019

Svako ko je sinoć uživo gledao utakmicu između Evertona i Totenhema u okviru 11. kola Premijer lige, verovatno je još uvek pod utiskom strašne povrede Andrea Gomesa. Fudbaler Evertona je nakon starta Sona, a potom i Orijea u bolovima završio na travi, a svi fudbaleri na terenu su se uhvatili za glavu.
Epilog je bio takav da je Son dobio direktan crveni karton, te da je u suzama i potpuno rastrojen napustio teren. Kako je kasnije Dele Ali naglasio u izjavi za medije, južnokorejski fudbaler dugo nakon meča nije mogao da se sabere i nastavio je da plače i u svlačionici. Tešili su ga svi redom, pa čak i jedan od najiskusnijih u redovima fudbalera Evertona, Šejmus Kolmen.
Lekarska ekipa na Gudison Parku je brzo imobilisala Andrea Gomesa i transportovala ga u obližnju bolnicu Ejntri, gde su sinoć u toku večeri urađeni kompletni pregledi kao priprema za operaciju koja je po planu bila zakazana za danas. Utvrđeno je da je igrač Karamela zadobio težak prelom i dislokaciju desnog skočnog zgloba.
Ali, kako navode iz Evertona na zvaničnom sajtu, današnji zahvat je prošao u najboljem mogućem redu. Portugalski fudbaler je odlično podneo operaciju, a sada će provesti određeno vreme u bolnici, pre nego što se vrati u Finč Farm, trening kamp Evertona, gde će započeti rehabilitaciju pod nadzorom klupskog medicinskog tima. Navodi se da će Portugalac uspeti u potpunosti da se oporavi od stravične povrede i ponovo se posveti fudbalu.
Svi se nadaju da će Gomes krenuti stopama upravo Šejmusa Kolmena, kao i Janika Bolasija, koji su u poslednjih nekoliko godina takođe doživeli teške povrede, ali su uspeli da se vrate na teren i zaigraju na najvećoj sceni.

text:
Gomes successfully operated, complete recovery is expected
The good news comes from Goodison

04 Nov 2019

Anyone who watched the match between Everton and Tottenham in the Premier League Round 11 last night is probably still under the impression of a terrible injury to Andre Gomes. Everton footballers ended up on the pitch after the start of Sona and then Oriya in pain, with all the players on the pitch clutching their heads.
The epilogue was such that Son received a direct red card and, in tears, left the pitch completely distracted. As Dele Ali later pointed out in a press statement, the South Korean footballer could not collect himself long after the match and continued to cry in the locker room. He was comforted by everyone, and even one of the most experienced Everton football players, Seamus Coleman.
The medical team at Goodison Park quickly immobilized Andre Gomes and transported him to nearby Aintree Hospital, where full screenings were performed last night to prepare for the surgery scheduled for today. The Caramel player was found to have suffered a severe fracture and dislocation of his right ankle.
But according to Everton's official website, today's intervention has gone to the best of our ability. The Portuguese footballer had a great operation, and will now spend some time in hospital before returning to Finch Farm, Everton's training camp, where he will begin rehab under the supervision of a club medical team. It is stated that the Portuguese will be able to fully recover from the horrific injury and re-dedicate himself to football.
Everyone hopes that Gomes will follow in the footsteps of Seamus Coleman, as well as Janik Bolasi, who have also suffered serious injuries in recent years but have managed to get back on the field and play on the biggest stage.
